alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Castle Country; Eastern Juab, Millard Counties; Sanpete Valley; Sevier Valley; Southwest Utah; Tooele and Rush Valleys; Utah Valley; Western Millard and Juab Counties; Western Uinta Basin (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 12 at 2:27PM MDT until October 13 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28. * WHERE...Rush Valley, outlying areas of southern Utah County, the western Uinta Basin, Millard and Juab Counties, the Sanpete and Sevier Valleys, Castle Country, southwest Utah and the Capitol Reef National Park area, especially Bicknell and Loa. * WHEN...Until 9 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will fall back to below freezing overnight tonight into Friday morning.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
